page.title: 02The Holy House
page.content: In 1061{Richeldis},a Saxon widow,was commanded by the{Virgin Mary}to build,in Walsingham,a replica of her childhood house in{Nazareth}.As the site had not been made clear Richeldis,needing guidance,spent the night in prayer.The following morning she walked in a nearby meadow and found two areas free of dew.She chose the one by two holy wells.At first the workmen could make no progress with their building and so the worried lady spent a further night in prayer.At sunrise she ventured out and found her little house complete and miraculously transported to the other site almost seventy metres away.In 1153 an{ {Augustinian}priory was founded and{The {Holy House}was later encased in a stone chapel beside the nave of a great church and a monastic complex.
